TopicTitle: Will Gas Giant 2 along side other unimplemented Nova Silisko planets be implemented in KSP2?

Articles.Content: Will more celestial bodies be added to the original Kerbol System in KSP2? Also, will Nova Silisko's unimplemented planets in KSP be added in KSP2?

No, and no.

It has been stated that no changes will be made to the structure of the Kerbol system, and all new celestial bodies will be outside its (no longer infinite) sphere of influence.

There was a tease of a planet being added to the Kerbin system, on an extremely distant orbit - likely only discoverable with space telescopes or later-game tech.

Regarding additional gas giants, I remember the plans for this and Laythe becoming volcanic in KSP1, I assume these kinds of additions will be included within other star systems rather than changing the original system drastically.

What about these for ksp2?

https://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Planned_features

probably not but who knows?

6 hours ago, TheKSPBeginner said:

No, and no.

It has been stated that no changes will be made to the structure of the Kerbol system, and all new celestial bodies will be outside its (no longer infinite) sphere of influence.

Aw man

4 hours ago, Nirgal said:

There was a tease of a planet being added to the Kerbin system, on an extremely distant orbit - likely only discoverable with space telescopes or later-game tech.

Regarding additional gas giants, I remember the plans for this and Laythe becoming volcanic in KSP1, I assume these kinds of additions will be included within other star systems rather than changing the original system drastically.

What tease?

Apart from the possible hint given in one of the recent videos, there will be no new bodies in the stock system. It is possible however that we may see some of Nova's old ideas updated and used in other systems, which I would love to see. We won't know for some time most likely.

6 hours ago, Emilius73 said:

What tease?

In one of the videos, you can see what looks like a chart of Kerbol system with this little addition. It's never been clarified if this meant to imply a new planet on Kerbol, something beyond Kerbol system entirely, or just a silly Easter egg.

1 hour ago, K^2 said:

In one of the videos, you can see what looks like a chart of Kerbol system with this little addition. It's never been clarified if this meant to imply a new planet on Kerbol, something beyond Kerbol system entirely, or just a silly Easter egg.
